abstracts.cdata!:
This is the project completion report
            (PCR) of the Operation de developpement integre des
            productions arachidiere et cerealier (ODIPAC) Technical
            Assistance Project in Mali. The project was implemented
            under the eighth International Development Association (IDA)
            credit for the development of the agricultural sector in
            Mali and the second in the western and central area. The
            project area, in southwest Mali, is almost 700 km from west
            to east with an annual rainfall between 700 mm and 1000 mm,
            and is very diverse, ethnically and physically. Its
            agriculture is considered, by Sahelian standards, to be
            quite good, that is, within the limits of sparse and erratic
            rainfall dictating risk-adverse cultivation practices.
            Agriculture is the most important activity in Mali and some
            85 percent of the population is engaged in it. The project
            area has a population exceeding half a million and was not
            nearly as well developed in terms of infrastructure and
            social services as other parts of the country.
